questions.stem: Regarding the round ligament, choose the best answer:
options: It is posterior to the uterus.
It supports the fundus of the uterus.
It passes through the inguinal canal.
It contains the neuromuscular bundle supplying the ovary.

questions.stem: Which of the following ligaments is responsible for uterine anteverted position:
You are performing an outpatient hysteroscopy while investigating postmenopausal bleeding. What is the most common cause of failure to obtain a good view of the cavity?

You have performed a vaginal hysterectomy for a 60-year-old woman. There was some difficulty dissecting the bladder. At the end of the surgery, there was clear urine in the drainage catheter. Two weeks later, the patient came complaining of continuous leaking of urine vaginally. O/E and methylene blue test, you noticed a vesicovaginal fistula of <5 mm diameter. What is your first-line management?
options: Advise her to use vaginal tampons and return for surgical repair after three months.
Check if she has a urinary infection.
Insert a suprapubic catheter to see if the patient remains dry.
Insert a Foley catheter for three to four weeks and review in four weeks.
Insert a Foley catheter for life.

questions.stem: A patient who had a total hysterectomy is referred to ER because of a surgical site wound infection (SSI). She was threatening to sue the hospital because she thinks it is due to acquired hospital infection. Most common cause of SSI?
options: Contamination by micro-organisms from the patient's own body.
Contamination from the operating theatre environment.

questions.stem: You were asked to perform a total abdominal hysterectomy because of a large right broad ligament fibroid. What is the best way to avoid ureteric injury?
options: Ask a urological surgeon to assist you to help prevent injury.
Dissection and visualization of the ureter.
Intraoperative insertion of a ureteric catheter to identify the ureter.
Intraoperative insertion of illuminating ureteric catheters.
Preoperative intravenous urography to identify the course of the ureter.

questions.stem: A 21-year-old young woman is booked for diagnostic laparoscopy for chronic pelvic pain. Her BMI is 19. Her highest risk of complication is:
A 64-year-old lady is having ovarian debulking surgery. The disadvantages of her having a midline incision are as follows:
options: The abdomen and pelvis can be entered rapidly.
She will have better cosmetic result.

questions.stem: A 38-year-old woman underwent TAH with ovarian preservation for heavy menstrual bleeding yesterday, now she is pale with BP: 110/68, pulse: 88, T: 36.8. her abdomen is soft, but there is considerable tenderness in the left lower quadrant. her urine output since surgery has been 350ml. Patient was very dizzy and light headed, and vomited when she was taken out of bed that morning. the most appropriate management:
options: Ensures the patient has adequate analgesics and prescribe extra IV fluids and antiemetic.
Takes a urine sample and start IV antibiotics.
Arranges for CBC and ask for review by your consultant.
Explain that the patient does not require HRT and review her that afternoon.

questions.stem: Which of the following ligaments is responsible for uterine support?

options: It is independent of hormonal influence.
It is lined by ciliated epithelium.
It lies in the round ligament.

options: Injury of a major abdominal vessel.

questions.stem: Operative hysteroscopy is the best therapeutic approach for:
A mother brings her 9-year-old girl for circumcision. How can you counsel the mother?
options: Procedure could be done at this age.
Decision depends on the size and shape of external genitalia.
It is preferable to wait till the age of menarche.
It is preferable to wait till marriage.
It is considered a genital mutilation that is medicolegally forbidden.

Postoperative reactionary hemorrhage after vaginal operation:
options: Is hemorrhage occurring during the operation.
Occurs usually on the 10th postoperative day due to sepsis.
In these cases, it is recommended to avoid any sutures in the friable tissues.
Intractable hemorrhage occurring intraoperative as a result of excessive dissection.

questions.stem: Regarding the round ligament, choose the correct statement:
options: It is an embryonic remnant of Wolffian duct.
It is attached to the posterior wall of the uterine fundus.
It constitutes the main ligamentous support of the uterus.
It is responsible for the anteverted uterine position.

questions.stem: Anomalies of the uterus can be associated with all the following EXCEPT:
the LEAST complication seen with HSG is:
The least site for ureteric injury during hysterectomy is:
options: During parametrial dissection and lymph node removal in radical surgery.

Regarding embryology of female reproductive system, the following is true:
options: Ovaries are developed from Wolffian ducts.
Streak gonads are due to absent Mullerian duct.
Fetal external genitalia are not androgen dependent.
Imperforate hymen is due to aplasia of Mullerian ducts.
Septate uterus is due to failed fusion of Mullerian ducts.

questions.stem: The broad ligament contains all the following structures EXCEPT:

Ovarian artery is a branch of which artery:
options: Anterior branch of internal iliac artery.

questions.stem: You are describing the normal ovaries to a fellow student. Which of the following characteristics of the normal ovary is correct:
options: They normally remain constant in size throughout a woman's lifetime.
They are supported by the round ligaments.
They secrete hormones and store germ cells.

questions.stem: All the following are true EXCEPT:
options: Urogenital sinus develops into the lower portion of the vagina.
Genital tubercle forms the upper portion of the vagina.
Genital folds develop into the labia minora.
Genital swelling develops into the labia majora.

options: It is the widest portion of the tube.
It opens in the peritoneal cavity.

questions.stem: Aplasia of the fallopian tube is associated with:
options: Absence of the upper 34th of the vagina.

questions.stem: Pelvic ultrasound is a useful tool in diagnosing of all the following conditions EXCEPT:

MRI may be used for the diagnosis of all the following EXCEPT:
options: Evaluation of uterine fibroids to identify the size, numbers and location of the fibroids.
Differentiate between adenomyosis and uterine leiomyoma.

questions.stem: All the following risks can commonly occur with diagnostic hysteroscopy EXCEPT:

The levator ani muscle:
options: Is attached laterally to the white line of the pelvis.
Is composed of pubococcygeus and iliococcygeus muscles.
Contracts to prevent spillage of urine during strain.

questions.stem: The following is an advantage of vaginal hysterectomy over abdominal hysterectomy:
options: More suitable for cases with suspected marked pelvic adhesions.
Ovaries could be removed safely as in abdominal hysterectomy.
Lower incidence of bladder and ureteric injury.
Lower incidence of intestinal complications and peritonitis.

questions.stem: What is the most serious complication specific to hysteroscopy:
options: Injury of a major pelvic vessel.

questions.stem: The following pathologies is due to remnants of Wolffian ducts in females:
Rectal examination in gynecology has all the following uses EXCEPT:
options: Cases with old complete perineal tear.

questions.stem: The uterine artery arises from which of the following?
Therapeutic uses of laparoscopy include:
options: Surgical treatment of cervical ectopic pregnancy.
Commonly used in ovum pick up in assisted reproduction.

questions.stem: HSG is contraindicated in all the following conditions, EXCEPT:
Regarding female circumcision:
options: It helps to decrease sexual desire in conservative communities.
It has the same value of male circumcision.
It can be done in the neonatal period

questions.stem: Diagnosis of Turner syndrome.
Diagnosis of pelvic endometriosis.
Diagnosis of submucous fibroid polyp.
Diagnosis of Asherman syndrome.
Diagnosis of invasive cancer cervix.
Contained in the infundibulopelvic ligament.
The origin of the uterine artery.
Should always be removed at hysterectomy to cure endometriosis.
The ureter is at surgical risk where it runs close to this structure.
Develops into the uterus, cervix and proximal 2/3 of the vagina.
Forms the ovary.
Develops into the distal one third of the vagina.
Develops into the labia minora in females.
Develops into the scrotum in males.
Develops into the penis in males.
Develops into the urinary system in females.
Lymphatic drainage of the ovary.
options: Obturator, internal and external iliac nodes.

questions.stem: Lymphatic drainage of the lower vagina and vulva.
options: Obturator, internal and external iliac nodes.

questions.stem: Lymphatic drainage of the upper vagina and cervix.
options: Obturator, internal and external iliac nodes.

questions.stem: Venous drainage from the left ovarian vein.
options: Obturator, internal and external iliac nodes.

questions.stem: Superior vesical artery.
options: Obturator, internal and external iliac nodes.

questions.stem: A chaperone in always needed for intimate examination.
In its upper portion the ureter lies anterior to the ovary.
Bicornuate uterus requires hysteroscopic metroplasty to improve fertility rates.
The peritoneum overlies the uterus in whole or in part.
The peritoneum overlies the ovary in whole or in part.
Congenital adrenal hyperplasia have XX karyotype.
Rokitansky's syndrome have XX Karyotype.
Turner's syndrome have XX Karyotype.
Androgen insensitivity syndrome have XX Karyotype.
Per Rectum examination is a MUST in all gynecological cases.
Bimanual examination can determine whether a pelvic mass is ovarian or uterine in origin.
Laparoscopy is the gold standard to diagnose pelvic endometriosis.
Hysteroscopy is the gold standard to diagnose endometrial polypi.
Gold standard investigation to evaluate the tubes in cases of infertility is hysterosalpingography.
Girls at the age of 8, should be screened to detect the need for FGM.
Removal of clitoris, both labia minora and both labia majora is considered type 4 FGM.
Laparoscopy can accurately differentiate between bicornuate and septate uterus.
Hysteroscopy can accurately differentiate between bicornuate and septate uterus.
